# Title
## Professional Services for Climate Transition Risk Software Application
The Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions (OSFI) is issuing a notice to invite interested suppliers to take part in a procurement process for professional services related to climate transition risk software application.

## Background
OSFI has a requirement for consulting services and support to implement the Paris Agreement Capital Transition Assessment (PACTA) tool and associated methodology. This initiative aims to develop climate transition risk assessments and metrics for Federally Regulated Financial Institutions (FRFI) banks and support OSFI's supervisory activities in this domain.

## SCOPE and OBJECTIVE
The scope of this procurement includes the provision of consulting services to support the implementation of PACTA for Banks software. The objective is to provide expertise and resources to facilitate workshops, develop a co-authored report, and undertake research and development to enhance the methodology and associated tools.

## Evaluation Criteria
The evaluation of supplier statements of capabilities will be based on the following criteria:

*   Ability to provide PACTA methodology and tool utilization capacity building, and knowledge transfer to OSFI staff;
*   Ability to provide technical implementation of PACTA for Banks software;
*   Ability to develop a co-authored report detailing the findings from the exercise of utilizing PACTA for Banks on Canadian FRFI banks;
*   Research and development of additional metrics for peer comparison.

## Pre-Selected Supplier
Rocky Mountain Institute (RMI) is the pre-selected supplier for this procurement, given their expertise in PACTA methodology and tool utilization, as well as their experience in implementing PACTA for banks and regulators.
